thread.title: 5 Must To See Monaco Tourist Attractions
thread.title_full: 5 Must To See Monaco Tourist Attractions

author: admin
title: 5 Must To See Monaco Tourist Attractions
text:
Home > Travel Destinations > 5 Must To See Monaco Tourist Attractions 5 Must To See Monaco Tourist Attractions By admin on July 27, 2015 Pin It 
Glittering and gorgeous Monaco is a royal but tiny principality located on French Riviera. The size of this little yet glamorous land stretch is just two square kilometers. 
The scenery of this city which borders with Italy and France possesses a seductive quality with lovely palm trees, vibrant flowers and deep blue sea. 
Monaco is a city filled with awe-inspiring natural beauty along with a balmy weather and lush vegetation. It has become one of the most interesting tourist destinations because of its classy places and beautiful landscapes. Top Monaco Tourist Attractions 
Have a look at some of the most famous Monaco tourist attractions, which you should not miss during your visit: Monte Carlo 
This is a place where luxury and decadence serve as the way of regular life. Monte Carlo is a district in Monaco possessing good amount of glamour and glitz. You can enjoy breathtaking views of the sea on your visit to this wealthiest district in Monaco. Palais du Prince 
Palais du Prince is located on the beautiful peninsula called Le Rocher and it serves as a home to one of the oldest monarchies in the world. At this palace, visitors get the scope of seeing the Italianate gallery which is adorned with frescoes from the 15th century. Oceanographic Museum And Aquarium 
At this museum you can feel and admire fun atmosphere. The museum has a collection of over 4000 marine life and fish. 
Tourists also get the chance of seeing history through exhibits, displays and films. The museum is located at Saint Martin road and it is a great place especially for children. Monaco Harbor 
Monaco harbor lies at the cliff foot and it is a busy port filled with yachts. Monaco harbor is square shaped and it was built between the years 1901 and 1926. It was basically built for offering berths for innumerable yachts. Museum Of Stamps And Coins 
At this museum you will find a collection of coins and stamps previously a possession of the royal family. All the coins and stamps at this museum are arranged and structured in a very neat and tidy manner.
